Apparently the first telegram that the Government of India received was a repetition of a telegram from Sir H.Bullard dated 30th August, in which he said that he and the Soviet Ambassador had seen the Prime Minister and the Minister for Foreign Affairs and had presented their terms. This, of course, was altogether wrong and I have asked Mr.Plowman what happened to Foreign Office telegram No.575 dated 27th August which sent to Sir P.Bullard the draft of instructions which were then under discussion with the Soviet Government. 1 found that this was repeated to the Government of India and it v/as sent from here at 3.30 a.m. on 28th August. Unfortunately, however, the Foreign Office, in sending the telegram to our Telegraph Branch for repetition to India, gave no indication on it that it had been marked ’'Immediate' 1 . mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between the Government of India's External Affairs Department and the Secretary of State for India regarding delayed telegrams related to the Persian situation.
